name: readelf

options.description: Display the symbol/file index in an archive
Use the dynamic section info when displaying symbols
Dump the contents of section <number|name> as bytes
Dump the contents of section <number|name> as strings
Dump the contents of section <number|name> as relocated bytes
Display the contents of DWARF debug sections
Display the contents of DWARF debug sections
Do not display DIEs at depth N or greater
Display DIEs starting with N, at the same depth or deeper
Use section <number|name> as the CTF parent
Use section <number|name> as the CTF external symtab
Use section <number|name> as the CTF external strtab
Display histogram of bucket list lengths
Allow output width to exceed 80 characters
Display the version number of readelf

tldr:
> Displays information about ELF files.
> More information: <http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man1/readelf.1.html>.

- Display all information about the ELF file:

`readelf -all {{path/to/binary}}`

- Display all the headers present in the ELF file:

`readelf --headers {{path/to/binary}}`

- Display the entries in symbol table section of the ELF file, if it has one:

`readelf --symbols {{path/to/binary}}`

- Display the information contained in the ELF header at the start of the file:

`readelf --file-header {{path/to/binary}}`
